org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types

Class IPv4Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPAddress<IPv4Address>
      • org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<IPv4Address>, Writeable, OFValueType<IPv4Address>, PrimitiveSinkable

    public class IPv4Address
extends IPAddress<IPv4Address>
implements Writeable
    Wrapper around an IPv4Address address
    Author:
    Andreas Wundsam <andreas.wundsam@bigswitch.com>

        Description copied from class: IPAddress

        Specified by:

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv4Address of(@Nonnull
                     byte[] address)
        Returns an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in address[0].

        The address byte array must be 4 bytes long (32 bits long).

        Similar to InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[]).

        Parameters:
        address - the raw IP address in network byte order
        Returns:
        an IPv4Address object that represents the given raw IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given address was null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given address was of an invalid byte array length
        See Also:
        InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[])

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv4Address of(int raw)
        Returns an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address.
        Parameters:
        raw - the raw IP address represented as a 32-bit integer
        Returns:
        an IPv4Address object that represents the given raw IP address

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv4Address of(@Nonnull
                     String string)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is in the canonical quad-dotted notation. For example, 1.2.3.4.
        Parameters:
        string - the IP address in the canonical quad-dotted notation
        Returns:
        an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given string was null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string was not a valid IPv4 address

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv4Address of(@Nonnull
                     Inet4Address address)
        Returns an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is given as an Inet4Address object.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address as an Inet4Address object
        Returns:
        an IPv4Address object that represents the given IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given Inet4Address was null

      • ofCidrMaskLength

        @Nonnull
public static IPv4Address ofCidrMaskLength(int cidrMaskLength)
        Returns an IPv4Address object that represents the CIDR subnet mask of the given prefix length.
        Parameters:
        cidrMaskLength - the prefix length of the CIDR subnet mask (i.e. the number of leading one-bits), where 0 <= cidrMaskLength <= 32
        Returns:
        an IPv4Address object that represents the CIDR subnet mask of the given prefix length
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given prefix length was invalid

      • withMask

        @Nonnull
public IPv4AddressWithMask withMask(@Nonnull
                                   IPv4Address mask)
        Returns an IPv4AddressWithMask object that represents this IP address masked by the given IP address mask.
        Specified by:
        withMask in class IPAddress<IPv4Address>
        Parameters:
        mask - the IPv4Address object that represents the mask
        Returns:
        an IPv4AddressWithMask object that represents this IP address masked by the given mask
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given mask was null

        @Nonnull
public IPv4AddressWithMask withMaskOfLength(int cidrMaskLength)

        Specified by:

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns the raw IP address of this IPAddress object. The result is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getBytes()[0].

        Similar to InetAddress.getAddress()

        Specified by:
        getBytes in class IPAddress<IPv4Address>
        Returns:
        the raw IP address of this object
        See Also:
        InetAddress.getAddress()
